alfredsnippet.snippet:
Fred Hoyle, The Universe: Past And Present Reflections, Ann. Rev. Astron. Astrophys. 1982. 20, p.23

"A dog cannot understand the operation of a power station because of limitations in the scope of its backing storage, and in a like fashion we have trouble with problems of religion, even if one is incorrigibly attracted to them like moths to a candle (as scientists are)."
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Hoyle on Religion
